author: matthiasksieber
title: Adatar.me for BTC
description: BTC’s hashed public key based wallet addresses are not human-readable and do not offer personalization.

f6_assessments.q0:
[Disclaimer: The Loxe Inc. Team have submitted 19 proposals that are all related to the addition of support for various blockchains to Adatar.me. These proposals are very similar in their structure and vision. As a result, the assessments for this set of proposals will also be similar.]

As explained in the campaign brief of this challenge setting, multi-chain adoption is a necessary issue that the future blockchains will have to address. Long and tedious addresses have been a topic (and issue?) within the blockchain domain for a long time. Long addresses are hard to handle, easy to misspell and there are multiple variants of malware that swaps the receiving address when a user copy pastes an address during a transaction. These are a few of the arguments as to why the functionality in the solution is needed.
By providing this alias solution to Bitcoin we also increase the possibility of their community discovering Cardano and Project Catalyst. This might also lead to an increased amount of new member on-boarded to the community.
The team behind the proposal is doing a good job proving that their solution hold a strong coupling to the goals set in the campaign. In terms of impact, the proposed solution proves impactful to a strong degree within cross-chain collaboration. In line with the arguments mentioned above, this proposal is rated 5-stars in terms of impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Loxe Inc. team consists of experienced members that have been involved within the Cardano and Catalyst ecosystem for a long time. They have already delivered the foundation of the Adatar.me platform from a previous funding round. Their credibility is unquestionable and the proposal is deemed feasible to the highest degree. However, the proposal acknowledges the project as a low-risk project where much of the solution is already built and it's only a question of connecting the backend to their platform. It would be interesting if the proposers reflected a bit on the technical challenges of integrating Bitcoin into the Adatar.me platform. In the current state of the proposal, the complexity is regarded identical between all blockchains. 

This proposal is assessed individually, so the following reflections does not affect the score of this individual proposal but they are still worth mentioning.
There is a total of 19 related proposals submitted, that is around 150k dollars if all proposals were to be funded and that would equal over 35% of the total funding for the challenge. It is good to have that number in the back of the mind while voting in order to estimate the collection of proposals against other proposals that requests bigger sums of funding. 
Also, it is mentioned that the integration will take one full month of work to complete. The proposers have acknowledged this in their estimate of delivery but there is a big difference of workload if only a few vs. all proposals got funded. In the latter case, 19 months of work will have to be performed until the end of Q4. This question could be interesting to expand further upon.
To sum it all, the proposal is regarded as highly feasible and receives a score of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones for measuring the progress is sufficient enough and it is deemed not necessary to report on a more detailed level given the scope, complexity and risk of the proposal. The success is partly defined by organic adoption by the Bitcoin community. It would however be interesting to have real numbers estimated together with this metric. As mentioned in the proposal, it is not a big challenge to measure the actual number of transaction made through the adatar.me platform. The wording of "organic adoption by its community" is rather vague and passive, indicating that even the tiniest adoption of the platform is considered a success. A more ambitious goal with real numbers would be preferable so that the community can follow up the success of the project more easily. Therefore, the score given in terms of auditability is 4 stars.

f6_assessments.q0:
Please note that the proposers, Loxe Inc. have submitted over 15 similar proposals aiming to extend the adatar.me platform to a variety of different blockchains. Therefore, parts of my reviews of these proposals will be a general assessment of these similar proposals. However, the reviews will be customized to the relevant blockchain discussed. 

I give the proposers a five star rating on impact as the solution clearly aligns with the KPIs and goals of the challenge, aiming to implement cardano based solutions to other blockchains. Today's BTC transaction technology requires a long and complex wallet-address which makes payments and transactions exhausting to complete. Providing an avatar based solution could greatly impact the accessibility of blockchain transactions. It would however be interesting to discuss how the proposers would ensure adaptation of the adatar.me solution by BTC users that might be biased towards BTC based technology.
f6_assessments.q1: I give the feasibility of this proposal a four star rating. Seeing that the proposers have already received funding and successfully implemented a project from Fund 6, I find it very realistic that they would be able to complete this project. Furthermore the team consists of five established team members with long and relevant experience within the field which strengthens their credibility. The proposers also include a realistic view of the project timeline, taking into consideration the uncertainty of the number of their proposals that will get approved and how this could affect the time needed for completion. In order to receive a five star rating I would recommend the proposers to discuss the complexity of implementing a backend solution for the specific coin, in this case BTC. Will it be more challenging to develop a solution for the Bitcoin blockchain than it was for ADA? Additionally I would recommend the team to give a more detailed budget and roadmap that breaks down what the development process would look like. Lastly, it would be good to give further reflections regarding what happens if all of the Loxe Inc. proposals in Fund 8 gets approved. How would this impact delivery times and would you be able to complete several projects parallel to each other?
f6_assessments.q2: I give the audibility of the proposed project a three star rating as the reader is given only two explicit milestones to measure the progress of the project: when the extension launches in testnet and once it is launched in the mainnet. In order to achieve a higher rating I would recommend the proposers to break down the project into smaller milestones that could be communicated to the Cardano community along the way, allowing for greater transparency.  Furthermore I recommend that the proposers take a closer look at detailed KPIs of success when the extension is fully implemented in order to measure the actual value provided by adatar.me. Examples of this could be X numbers of users registering their BTC wallet to adatar.me, X% growth in transactions using the adatar.me solution or numbers of BTC transactions conducted using adatar.me avatars. This would ensure that the Loxe Inc. team could provide data regarding the actual adaptation of their solution.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of ​​the project is very useful. The project helps people who often forget to check their address if I can feel more secure in transactions. Moreover, these avatars are more aesthetic than regular qr codes because the qr code looks very boring. The project has come a long way from Fund 6 to here and I believe the project will successfully solve the problem of transactions originating from complex wallet addresses.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan that the project provides is quite detailed in terms of time and work items. I understand that this roadmap requires flexibility and I believe that with the team's experience, the project can be completed on schedule. The project also has a team with many experienced members in the blockchain field. Therefore, I believe the project has a very high probability of success. I hope to experience the project's products soon
f6_assessments.q2: The information that the project provides about the roadmap as well as the detailed budget analysis is quite complete. However, to increase transparency for the project, I suggest that it is necessary to provide more checklists in the use of investment capital. This checklist will update the balance, expenditures to stakeholders, thereby increasing transparency for the project. In addition, because the plan is flexible, setting KPIs will be more difficult to track.

f6_assessments.q0: The Challenge's criteria are met as this integration would be helpful to the BTC community, offering them human-readable addresses and a registry. Human-readable addresses, in my opinion, would be beneficial to all blockchain users. This app has the potential to contribute value to the Cardano ecosystem in the future if it gains popularity in the BTC community.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has already developed and launched adatar.me and integrated with Cardano, therefore there is little risk in their capacity to deliver this integration within the promised timeframe. More technical information regarding the blockchain specific implementation might have been useful for us to gauge the complexity of the work, as well as how the front end will look. The budget for the dev might be on the high side - but still fits within the acceptable range. I have rated only 2 stars here as marketing information is lacking. Building the integration is only one step into success - it would have been useful to see how adatar plans to introduce the app to the BTC community, what are the existing wallet solutions that exist within that community and how adatar.me is a better solution than what currently exists. In addition, a market-research has not been provided to assess the demand, in numbers of potential users or functionality. Without adoption, a project cannot be successful, and I can only completely recommend supporting a project if it is accompanied by a good marketing plan or vision; otherwise, we risk funding an integration with limited usage. I would advise doing some market research first before any technical implementation and submitting a new proposal next round with the results of the market research, a marketing plan, budget, and the technical implementation plan.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is insufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. Some key KPIs are missing, including the number of BTC users that will be reached to promote the app, the number of expected active users, and the number of payments that will be made via the integration each month. Due to the lack of these KPIs, the success of this proposal depends solely on the technical completion of the integration, rather than the success of linking Cardano to the BTC community. Marketing and technical implementation should be thought of and planned at the same, even if done in sequence or stages. Without a marketing plan for adoption, requesting funding only for the technical side puts the Catalyst funds at risk.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Adatar implementation for BTC is definitely a great way to go. A simple adaptation from already existing tools on the Cardano Blockchain to other DLT/Blockchain ecosystems is an effective approach in introducing cross chain collaboration use cases. The Proposal is therefore in strong alignment with the Challenges Purpose.


The Proposer mentioned that they are working on several blockchain implementation proposals. A link to the related proposals would have been helpful to understand more about the overall Strategy of Loxe inc in regard to their Cross Chain Collaboration vision

This Proposal covers the costs for the Development, but how does the Proposer effectively onboard new users ? 

I would recommend the Proposers to add additional marketing & Pr budgets in future proposals to ensure that builded tools are widely used.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Proposers idea is to adapt an already existing tool ( adatarm.me ) from Loxe.inc. As the proposers offer a simple addition function to their already existing tool, a successful implementation of the Proposal is very likely
The Team behind Loxe Inc has successfully proven its skills and commitment through previous funding rounds and provides a largely open roadmap to ensure correct expectation management.
f6_assessments.q2: The success of the proposal is defined by the adatar.me BTC extension in testnet and mainnet at the beginning and end of Q4 2022, respectively. However, the proposer does not include any links on how the project's progress can be tracked and audited, ( eg. website blog announcements, github repos etc ).

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem identified in this proposal (poor UX in crypto wallets due to non human readable addressess) makes sense and is an issue that has been continuously discussed in the crypto community for a few years now. The common use of non human readable addresses causes strangeness and insecurity in less tech savvy users, so solutions that move in this direction are positive. The proposed solution is within the scope of the challenge. 

There is no clear articulation on how this proposal will add value to the Cardano blockchain. Considering that the proposed solution doesn't require on-chain code at this time, there is no clear indication on how the Cardano blockchain will be used. I clearly see that creating a model that allows the use of custom and "human readable" addresses for Bitcoin blockchain would bring great value to the Bitcoin ecosystem (increasing the ease of mass adoption) but there is no clear retribution to the Cardano community in addition to a possible increase in the prestige of Cardano and Catalyst for the recognition of joint development. 

An item/risk that would be important to judge the potential impact of this proposal would be to know the competition of similar projects supporting Bitcoin addressess as well, as this would indicate the space for the development of a solution and the demand. 

There are no metrics/targets that could facilitate impact assessment evaluation. I would recommend including metrics/KPIs that could more clearly indicate the impact of this proposal on the Cardano and Catalyst communities. 

**This proposal used a template due to the similarity between them. The team explained the reason for using the templates. The only significant change between the proposals is the target blockchain. Because of this, I will use standard assessments, modifying only the different points between them, which can cause similarity alerts in the assessment.**
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a proposal for the expansion of Adatar. The project was funded in F6, aims to deliver human readable addresses on Cardano, mainnet lauched in Feb 2022, is in full development and is offering support in several Cardano wallets. 

The team described experiences relevant to the development of the proposal and there is evidence of their expertise on the website www.loxeinc.com 

The budget will be completely used to pay developers. The value defined for the payment of developers for 1 month of work is compatible with market values. It would be important to have an hourly estimate for the development stages, testing and implementation of the Bitcoin extension to understand more clearly if the budget is appropriate, but considering the deliverables of this proposal, the amount is reasonable. 

There is a forecast for the integration of adatar.me to BTC to take 1 month, but due to the large number of parallel proposals proposed by the team there is uncertainty about when the project will be delivered, which made the team define the launch of adatar .me BTC extension testnet at the beginning of Q4(2022) and the mainnet at the end of Q4(2022). From what I can understand, if the team gets funding for many proposals, there will be a considerable backlog, which increases the uncertainty about the roadmap. 

No significant risks were identified for the development of the project. As the integration of adatar.me will not require on chain code, the complexity of the proposal decreases as it facilitates the integration with different blockchains. 

**This proposal used a template due to the similarity between them. The team explained the reason for using the templates. The only significant change between the proposals is the target blockchain. Because of this, I will use standard assessments, modifying only the different points between them, which can cause similarity alerts in the assessment.**
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap for this proposal could be more clear, this is partly justified due to the large number of parallel proposals that the team created. The proposal mentions that if many proposals come to be funded, there may be a backlog, so the milestones were defined for Q4, which helps in verifying the success of the proposal. 

The goal of "implementation of the adatar.me BTC extension " is clear, but "organic adoption by its community" is a subjective and ineffective definition of auditability. There are no metrics/KPIs, which undermines the performance evaluation capability of this proposal. 

Considering that the deliverable of the proposal is the creation of human readable addresses, I would recommend that the team include metrics that could assess the use of the service by Bitcoin users, as this would be an easily verifiable metric and a good indicator of success/auditability. There is a clear description of the problem and the proposed solution.

**This proposal used a template due to the similarity between them. The team explained the reason for using the templates. The only significant change between the proposals is the target blockchain. Because of this, I will use standard assessments, modifying only the different points between them, which can cause similarity alerts in the assessment.**

f6_assessments.q0: (The author writes a similar proposal "Adatar.me for ...", but the content will mostly be almost the same, so when I analyze the project, there will be similar sentences). Here a great idea a wallet address based on a hashed public key of BTC that is not readable and does not provide personalization is an important issue and it needs to address this Datar.me to BTC is really useful and perfectly suitable for scaling projects running on Cardano.The solution to this problem is due to the catalyst that makes it accepted by other chains and communities and the scaling of the projects. Cardano-based projects to other chains are also solutions that the author offers.This idea is suitable for the challenge of creating a healthy playground for the community to help the Cardano ecosystem grow.
f6_assessments.q1: (The author writes a similar proposal "Adatar.me for ...", but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project, there will be similar sentences. The author's proposal defines clear timelines at the beginning of the fourth quarter and the end of the fourth quarter of 2022. Launch adatar.me extension for BTC in testnet early Q4 2022. Launch adatar.me extension for BTC in mainnet late Q4 2022. Budget requested for this project is 8,000 $ this amount will be spent for one software engineer or 2 part time software engineers. This amount of money I see is consistent with the proposal of the project. The team consists of 5 people, I see the author clearly lists what the team's current work is doing and the number of years of experience of each member. They are experienced people in Blockchain and are assigned specific jobs suitable for each individual. The group profile is very transparent, detailed by the author through the link https://loxeinc.com, making it easy for the community to follow and know who they are and can contact them more easily when needed. With a lot of useful information that the author has listed in the group, I believe that if the project is funded, success will come to them.
f6_assessments.q2: (The author writes a similar proposal "Adatar.me for ...", but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project, there will be similar sentences. If all measurable indicators are displayed on the system of adatar.me BTC extension in testnet and mainnet at the beginning and end of Q4 2022 something related to the number of new Fund 8 proposals then I think this project will be 100% tested. This proposal is an extension of a previously funded proposal, from Foundation 6: https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/367448 with a score of 5 points with a vote of 2,502 single digits quite high. Proving that the project of fund 6 of the group has been watched and voted by the community a lot, I believe that with this fund 8, if the project is funded, it will definitely succeed.

f6_assessments.q0:
BTC. “Adatar.me for BTC” from the “Cross-Chain Collaboration” challenge aims to port the adatar.me service to BTC. Loxe, the team behind the project has submitted practically  identical proposals, for 18 different blockchain projects, plus a duplicate for LTC, which I assume the Catalyst moderation team will remove, so 19 in total at the time of writing, each with the intent to integrate the service with a different blockchain. Given the scope of the project(s) I don’t have a problem with this approach in particular, but there are some issues that I will address throughout this assessment.

I have meticulously verified the text of all 19 proposals (including the LTC duplicate submission) in a text editor that allows for snapshots and comparisons between snapshots (Scrivener), to make sure the content of the proposals is the same. They are practically identical, only the name of the blockchain project changes from proposal to proposal. In accordance with this I will be reviewing the proposals as a proposal set (group). Similar to the proposals, I will also change the name of the blockchain project in each one of my assessments and include the text “(this proposal)”, to mark the exact proposal, where relevant.
Unfortunately I cannot yet attach files to assessments, otherwise I would have provided visual evidence of this.

I appreciate the fact that the team has made an effort to acknowledge the fact that this proposal is part of a set of proposals by stating “in this fund, we are proposing a few proposals similar to this one, to extend adatar.me to some other blockchains”, but unfortunately, I don’t feel like they go nearly far enough to make this point clear and to provide sufficient detail regarding this. I would have really liked to see an attempt to better inform the community and the voters in this regard and include the exact number of proposals they have applied for funding in Fund 8, and a list of titles and links for full transparency.

As such, in an attempt to provide the voters with some context and for easy reference, I will be providing a full list of the “Adatar.me for [INSERT BLOCKCHAIN]” proposals:

	1)	Adatar.me for BTC (this proposal) - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398770
	2)	Adatar.me for ATOM - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398773
	3)	Adatar.me for EGLD - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398776 
	4)	 Adatar.me for MANA - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405373 
	5)	 Adatar.me for XRP - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405382 
	6)	Adatar.me for DOT - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405390 
	7)	Adatar.me for SOL - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405394 
	8)	Adatar.me for ALGO - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405398 
	9)	Adatar.me for AVAX - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405404 
	10)	Adatar.me for SHIB - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405417 
	11)	Adatar.me for LTC - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405427 
	12)	Adatar.me for LTC (duplicate) - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405436 
	13)	Adatar.me for DOGE - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405412 
	14)	Adatar.me for LINK - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405441 
	15)	Adatar.me for ETC - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405444 
	16)	Adatar.me for ETH - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405448 
	17)	Adatar.me for FTM - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405467 
	18)	Adatar.me for XTZ - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405472 
	19)	Adatar.me for IOTA - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405482 

I can understand  the thinking behind submitting a different proposal for each blockchain the team intends to port Adatar.me to, as opposed to having a single proposal with all blockchains. It allows the Cardano community to vote and fund those it deems necessary and views as worthwhile investments and voters can choose to allocate funds to as many as they want. Having said that, my concern is that the average voter will only discover and know of the existence of maybe 3 or 4 proposals as it stands, because the existence of the entire proposal set isn’t clearly and transparently pointed out to them. 

I really wish that the team had taken the time to make this point clear and to provide context. As this is more than a simple assessment of a proposal and is in fact the assessment for the entire proposal set I want to take the time to provide the voters with some context about the selected blockchains. Of course I can’t go into detail about each project, but I want to at least include one data point for quick comparison - their ranking by market cap. I know that’s not always the most relevant metric, but it can serve as an indication of a blockchain’s popularity:

The list will have the following structure:

Rank by Market Cap - Project Ticker (name) - Market Cap Value (in billion dollars on https://www.coingecko.com on 2022.03.24)

	•	1 - BTC  (this proposal) - $818B
	•	2 - ETH - $365B
	•	6 - XRP - $40B
	•	9 - SOL- $31B
	•	10 - DOT - $22B
	•	11 - AVAX - $22B
	•	12 - DOGE - $18B
	•	15 - SHIB - $13B
	•	20 - LTC - $8B
	•	22 - ATOM - $8B
	•	24 - LINK - $7B
	•	28 - ETC - $5B
	•	29 - ALGO - $5B
	•	36 - EGLD - $4.2B
	•	38 - MANA - $3.9B
	•	43 - FTM - $3.3B
	•	48 - XTZ - $3B
	•	60 - IOTA (MIOTA) - $2.1B

The prospect of porting a Cardano native project to multiple chains is one with a lot of potential in theory, and it definitely addresses the objectives of this challenge and I hope this effort will help the Cardano community decide which ones the treasury should invest in.

If this proposal actually manages to attract a sufficiently large part of the BTC community and actually use a product that has its origins on Cardano, thus exposing them to the Cardano ecosystem, the impact for the ecosystem could be huge. However, I have some reservations about that prospect actually happening based on the contents of this proposal, that I will outline throughout this assessment.

My main concern regarding the potential impact of the adatar.me project as a whole is related to its potential for adoption, first and foremost by the Cardano community, something that I view as necessary for it to be adopted by users of other chains. I have visited the adatar.me website and I've discovered that only 96 users have signed up and only 76 adatars have been created so far (at the time of writing). I find these numbers to be low considering that the project has received the exposure of being a successfully funded Project Catalyst initiative, as the proposal mentions. This is somewhat concerning and may be a signal of the project not gaining traction and being met with disinterest by the community. To put these number into perspective, the adahandle project, a project very similar in scope, and which only recently fully launched already has tens of thousands of users and close to 100,000 handle NFTs minted (91,290 NFTs minted under the policy ID at the time of writing).

Diversity in the ecosystem is a good thing and should definitely be encouraged, but it only matters if the the “other options” actually gain some traction and manage to attract a user base. The “Adatar.me - Growth Acceleration” https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/404995 proposal, submitted by the team in the Miscellaneous Challenge, is for marketing the project, but after reading that proposal I was left with the impression that marketing and promotion is an afterthought for the team.

However, the team is competent, and from their past engagements with the community I know they are dedicated to the Cardano mission. Because of this, I’m awarding +1 to my Impact score as a reflection of the hope that they will find solutions to this problems and try to be more transparent with their proposals in the future.

Side Note: 
In addition to the 18 Adatar.me for [INSERT BLOCKCHAIN] proposals requesting $144,000, Loxe, the team behind the avatar.me project has posted an additional 5 proposals to 3 different challenges, requesting an additional $207,000 in funding for the adatar.me project. Personally I don’t view this as a problem in itself, I just consider that the voting community should have been made aware of this.

F8: DApps and Integrations:
Adatar.me to NFT - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405209
Adatar.me Address Book - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405041

F8: Open Source Development Ecosystem:
Open API for Adatar.me - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405179
Adatar.me Website Widget - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/405027

F8: Miscellaneous Challenge:
Adatar.me - Growth Acceleration - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/404995
f6_assessments.q1:
Adatar.me for BTC is part of a set of 18 (+1 duplicate) functionally identical proposals that aim to enable the adatar.me project to integrate with different blockchains. Each proposal is for a different blockchain.

The roadmap is rather sparse and I would have definitely liked to see a bit more details about the engineering part of it, to make me feel that the team have a good understanding of the project(s) they are embarking on.

While I don’t necessarily find fault with the approach of submitting identical proposals for dealing with very similar tasks, that have only a single different parameter, for example translations into multiple languages of the same content, or as is the case here porting the same application to multiple blockchains, I do think it’s a problem that the volume of work for each one is estimated to be exactly the same. Even if the developers won’t be interacting with the blockchains themselves, but with the wallets for these blockchains, as they mention in the proposal, still every wallet and every blockchain is different, built with different technology, or with different approaches and on different principles. If this estimate is an average I would have liked to see that mentioned in the proposals.

The budget breakdown is just one line, but that is perfectly ok in this case since the whole budget of $8000 is intended to go towards the salary for one month of one developer. That’s roughly $50/hour assuming a 40 hour work week - that’s not a detail included in the proposal, but I think it should have been.

The budget requested for porting the Adatar.me solution to a single blockchain is low, but feasible, at $8000, however, the budget for all the 18 proposals (not counting the LTC duplicate) adds up to $144,000 out of the total challenge budget of $400,000. I don’t view this as a problem in itself, however, I wish the Loxe team would have been more transparent about this and made the info readily available in the proposal. That would have assured that the voters have a complete picture of what they are voting for.

As I’ve said, the proposals are identical, and a 1 month development time is given for each, but what will happen if all 18 or a large percentage of the proposals will be funded? Will they be done in sequence, meaning that it will take approximately 18 months to deliver the whole set? If this is the case what will determine the order of the sequence? In any case, that could mean the deliverables for this proposal(s) will be ready on mainnet at a much later date than the estimated Q4 2022. The proposals do mention that “other members of our team may be pulled into this work if needed”, but what will that mean for the actual development of the project? Is the team large enough, or will extra team members be hired? Most likely the team has some thoughts around this, and how they plan to execute, but I can only base my assessment on what’s in the text of the proposal(s), and unfortunately the proposals are very light on details regarding this, and my feasibility score reflects this issue.

A very good description of the team members involved with the development of this project is provided in the proposal, however since links to professional profiles (LinkedIn) or examples of other relevant previous work are not provided in the proposal, I had no way of verifying the claims around credentials and experience.
f6_assessments.q2:
Adatar.me for BTC is part of a set of 18 (+1 duplicate) functionally identical proposals that aim to enable the adatar.me project to integrate with different blockchains. Each proposal is for a different blockchain.

Since the team submitting this proposal have already received Catalyst grants they should already be very familiar with the auditability requirements of Project Catalyst. Given this fact I was expecting to see a lot more clarity around the deliverables, milestones, and KPIs of this proposal. 

What is present is definitely a good start, but my score reflects the fact that in this iteration of the proposals the Auditability section, lacks sufficient detail and clarity.

Elements that would turn any of this set of 18 proposal into better versions of themselves in case they need to be resubmitted:
A clearer description of its aim. Why is it important for a Cardano native project to integrate with other blockchains? And what would Cardano gain from that? 
A more descriptive, but still easy-to-follow plan for achieving its stated goals.
Unambiguous, quantifiable and trackable, metrics and KPIs for easy progress verification.
As an answer to the definition(s) of success question, try to identify milestones describing the expected, positive, results.

Note:
Assessing a set of 18(+1) proposals took approximately 2 days, almost the same amount of time as assessing 18 individually unique proposals, because of the steps I have described or included in the proposal, the cross-referencing with the other 5 avatar.me separate proposals plus the actual submission of 19 separate assessment on Ideascale.

f6_assessments.q0:
Note: This proposal has similar content compared to some other proposals that submitted by same proposer. But the reason the proposer gave in the proposal that is quite reasonable. So i assess all of these proposals and the content of the assessments may be the same. Just different in proposals that aim for Mana, Shiba and Link and the rating score of audibility section might be different that depend on my personal opinion about popularity, future potential, community size of blockchain or project!!!
Proposal has given a solution to create an intergration on Bitcoin blockchain based on adatar.me platform. For many people who are interested in adatar.me everyone knew that is a project renamed from Gravatar (a project was funded in fund 6). Assessing the suitable with the criteria set by challenge,then this proposalis completely suitable. I agree and dont need to mention it because the proposer also mentioned it in the proposal. This proposal is great and helpful for communities. Through adatar.me, Bitcoin user community will know Cardano or those who have accounts on both Bitcoin and Cardano can create same names for their wallet addresses. It bring convenience, cost saving, efficiency for users as the purpose of adatar.
f6_assessments.q1:
Assessing the detailed plan of the proposal, there really isnt too much to assess as this proposal is an extension of the original that was funded in fund 6. The deadline to complete proposal is Q4-2022. I think it absolutely reasonable because in this challenge, the proposer also has some similar proposals just a litte different about the target blockchain. It will be difficult to make a feasible plan if the proposer gives a deadline for completion that is too close and too specific. Because in the case, those similar proposals of proposer that i mentioned above are being funded, it would be unfeasible for a plan to complete the proposal at a timeline too close to Q2-2022.
Core team of proposal is a well-known team in the Cardano community and their competence is proven (Loxe Inc). The requested fund will use to pay for software engineers to build the product within a monght that is also reasonable compare with the potential of proposal. In addition, this proposal is an extension of an already active project, so it has a very high feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proposal's progress will be tracking through Bitcoin testnet and mainnet in Q4-2022 and specific time might be annouced when it ready. That's enough because proposal target is very simple. The success of the proposal is that a project developed and funded by Cardano catalyst will be known and used on the Bitcoin blockchain.
Success will be natural as it is a win-win project for the users of Cardano and Bitcoin. Even win-win with many blockchains if other proposal will also funded.

f6_assessments.q0:
Note to VCa : this proposal being very similar to several other proposals by the same team, my assessment may include similarities, intended to explain to voters the big picture project of the team.
This proposal covers an extension to BTC addresses of an ongoing project ADATAR.me which has been funded in Project Catalyst Fund 6. Success is defined by the successful implementation of the extension, and adoption of this new extension. 
This proposal matches the challenge main goal which includes the potential direction  “to expand Cardano based solution to other chains”. What I am lacking is how impactful the extension to this blockchain will be for the collaboration with Cardano, apart from the use on another blockchain of a Cardano originated service. 
Adatar.me offer to simplify the payment between people by offering an avatar connected to a wallet address and a search engine. One of the benefits is that it avoids doubling the payment fees, which happens when we make a first test transaction to verify that we target the correct wallet address.
f6_assessments.q1:
A functional prototype of ADATAR.me is available, and the proposal includes an instructive live demo made in a Gimbalab’s playground. Apart from this, the Loxe Inc. team is identified and show evidence of having the required skills to make the project successful.
The requested funding is low (8kUSD). No on-chain code is required. What must be done is a connection to a front-end wallet. The risk is very low for the community that the project would not succeed or that this funding would turn out as a bad investment. It is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: As this is a short project, the only metric proposed to monitor the progress of the project is the reach of the 2 milestones launch on test net (beginning Q4 2022)/ launch on main net (end of 2022). I would have expected intermediate milestones to follow the development of the wallet connection solution which is the main task of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: 👉NOTE! Because of the similarity content in the proposals, my assessments and rating for the proposals started with: 'Adatar.me for...' submitted by Victor Corcino and his team members in the same campaign Cross-Chain Collaboration might look similar. This is my thought after spending a lot of hours reading on those proposals and the previously funded proposal. This was not copied from anyone.👈 The Adatar project is really useful for the projects that are being built on the Cardano blockchain such as SundaeSwap, MinSwap, Liqwid... able to scale up to other blockchains. Within this proposal, they provide a solution to help the Cardano-based projects can be adopted by the BTC blockchain and its community. It is aligned with the challenge.  There are no significant risks during adding BTC to Adatar.me at all. I rate 5 stars for the Impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
👉NOTE! Because of the similarity content in the proposals, my assessments and rating for the proposals started with: 'Adatar.me for...' submitted by Victor Corcino and his team members in the same campaign Cross-Chain Collaboration might look similar. This is my thought after spending a lot of hours reading on those proposals and the previously funded proposal. This was not copied from anyone.👈 

For the roadmap, I know what you are worried about that is not sure which proposals are going to be funded, so your solution is to write a proposal for each blockchain separately. Then, there are 19 proposals with similar content were submitted to the same campaign. But if other projects make proposals to request funds for every their small milestones like what you have done. Our Catalyst community will have an extremely large number of proposals. The CAs and vCAs will have to spend a lot of time to assess these proposals; The CA bonus base budget for each proposal will be broken down; The voting community also doesn't know which of your proposals to vote for.  My suggestion is to focus on 1 proposal to request a bigger total budget, and a broken-down budget to add separately blockchain. This will limit the dispersion of resources of the Catalyst community, and your Adatar project will be highly valued in the minds of CAs and voters. I strongly believe in that because you have succeeded with the previous proposal in Fund 6. 

About the budget within this proposal, the $8.000 salary for 1 full-time (or 2 part-time) software engineer(s) is acceptable. It is the average salary for a software engineer in the US. But I have a question: Will you need 1 full-time engineer to integrate into the BTC blockchain only or will need several engineers to integrate into other blockchains? My understanding is this is an iterative work, almost their work follows a process, it is similar to Cardano blockchain, needs only 1 or a few engineer(s) can complete these tasks. Furthermore, because this is a continuation of a funded project, part of the cost of integrating onto the BTC or another blockchain is covered in the previously funded proposal ($84.000). Because of this reason, I will not rate the full stars. 

The team has 5 people, who are experienced engineers, who have worked together for a long time in Loxe company. We can easily communicate with them through the profile links attached on their company website https://loxeinc.com/#team. One of them is Victor Corcino who is quite friendly with the Catalyst community, as he is the one who built the toolkit for CAs, vCAs, and Voters.
f6_assessments.q2: 👉NOTE! Because of the similarity content in the proposals, my assessments and rating for the proposals started with: 'Adatar.me for...' submitted by Victor Corcino and his team members in the same campaign Cross-Chain Collaboration might look similar. This is my thought after spending a lot of hours reading on those proposals and the previously funded proposal. This was not copied from anyone.👈 - It is a very clear success of this proposal is the successful implementation of the adatar.me BTC extension and adoption by its community at the end of this year. This is an extension of a project that has been funded by Fund6. Its former name was 'Gravatar for ADA Wallets'. The proposal was on the top 5 of Fund6 power results and has attracted 2,502 individual wallets voted 'YES' with a total power of ₳401,288,824, which proves that the project has received great attention from the community. They have launched in mainnet in February 2022. For those reasons, I rate 5 stars for the Auditability.

experience: Loxe Inc. Team. Experienced team of software engineers and Plutus pioneers.
